psalm.title: Psalms
psalm.text:
[[Ps 18,2]]I love you, O LORD, my strength,
[[Ps 18,3a]]O LORD, my rock, my fortress, my deliverer.

[[Ps 18,3b]]My God, my rock of refuge,
[[Ps 18,3c]]my shield, the horn of my salvation, my stronghold!
[[Ps 18,4]]Praised be the LORD, I exclaim, 
and I am safe from my enemies.

[[Ps 18,5]]The breakers of death surged round about me, 
the destroying floods overwhelmed me;
[[Ps 18,6]]The cords of the nether world enmeshed me, 
the snares of death overtook me.

[[Ps 18,7]]In my distress I called upon the LORD 
and cried out to my God; 
From his temple he heard my voice, 
and my cry to him reached his ears.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint John
gospel.text:
[[Jn 10,31]]The Jews picked up rocks to stone Jesus.
[[Jn 10,32]]Jesus answered them, "I have shown you many good works from my Father. For which of these are you trying to stone me?"
[[Jn 10,33]]The Jews answered him, "We are not stoning you for a good work but for blasphemy. You, a man, are making yourself God."
[[Jn 10,34]]Jesus answered them, "Is it not written in your law, 'I said, "You are gods"'?
[[Jn 10,35]]If it calls them gods to whom the word of God came, and scripture cannot be set aside,
[[Jn 10,36]]can you say that the one whom the Father has consecrated and sent into the world blasphemes because I said, 'I am the Son of God'?
[[Jn 10,37]]If I do not perform my Father's works, do not believe me;
[[Jn 10,38]]but if I perform them, even if you do not believe me, believe the works, so that you may realize (and understand) that the Father is in me and I am in the Father."
[[Jn 10,39]](Then) they tried again to arrest him; but he escaped from their power.
[[Jn 10,40]]He went back across the Jordan to the place where John first baptized, and there he remained.
[[Jn 10,41]]Many came to him and said, "John performed no sign, but everything John said about this man was true."
[[Jn 10,42]]And many there began to believe in him.

first_reading.title: Book of Jeremiah
first_reading.text:
[[Jr 20,10]]I hear the whisperings of many: "Terror on every side! Denounce! let us denounce him!" All those who were my friends are on the watch for any misstep of mine. "Perhaps he will be trapped; then we can prevail, and take our vengeance on him."
[[Jr 20,11]]But the LORD is with me, like a mighty champion: my persecutors will stumble, they will not triumph. In their failure they will be put to utter shame, to lasting, unforgettable confusion.
[[Jr 20,12]]O LORD of hosts, you who test the just, who probe mind and heart, Let me witness the vengeance you take on them, for to you I have entrusted my cause.
[[Jr 20,13]]Sing to the LORD, praise the LORD, For he has rescued the life of the poor from the power of the wicked!
